sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

title.narrative: Outcome 1: Access to restore essential services is enabled
Outcome 1: Access to restore essential services is enabled

comment.narrative: Baseline 2018: 1,117 sites Result 2019: 524 sites (in Anbar, Ninewa, Kirkuk and Salah al-Din governorates, with the majority of sites surveyed upon a request from the DMA and based on FFS priorities. Cleared sites included FFS priorities and others as authorized by the DMA, including non-FFS public infrastructure such as schools and roads).

title.narrative: Output 1: A response to explosive hazards is coordinated and delivered in liberated areas

description.narrative: 1. # of surveys conducted 2. # of m2 surveyed 3. # of explosive hazard management tasks completed 4. # of explosive hazards rendered safe or destroyed in situ 5. # of missions in support of the UN undertaken 6. # of deployments 7. # of housing plots cleared (2019 onwards)

title.narrative: Output 1: A response to explosive hazards is coordinated and delivered in liberated areas

description.narrative: 1. # of surveys conducted 2. # of m2 surveyed 3. # of explosive hazard management tasks completed 4. # of explosive hazards rendered safe or destroyed in situ 5. # of missions in support of the UN undertaken 6. # of deployments 7. # of housing plots cleared (2019 onwards)

title.narrative: Outcome 2: Displaced people confidently and safely return to liberated areas

description.narrative: Outcome indicator: # of IDPs returning to liberated areas

title.narrative: Outcome 2: Displaced people confidently and safely return to liberated areas

description.narrative: Outcome indicator: # of IDPs returning to liberated areas

comment.narrative: Baseline 2018: The number of returning IDPs continued to increase in 2018 from approximately 3,220,000 people on 1 January to 4,113,000 people on 31 October, while approximately 1,860,000 people remain displaced (according to the IOM Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM)). Result 2019: 431,130 returnees overall between 31 December 2018 and 31 December 2019

title.narrative: Outcome 3: The Government of Iraq (GoI) has an enhanced ability to manage regulate and coordinate an explosive hazard response

description.narrative: Outcome indicator: # of policy documents, standards, strategies, processes that have been established/updated/enhanced

title.narrative: Outcome 3: The Government of Iraq (GoI) has an enhanced ability to manage regulate and coordinate an explosive hazard response

description.narrative: Outcome indicator: # of policy documents, standards, strategies, processes that have been established/updated/enhanced

comment.narrative: Baseline 2018: Seven processes/standards enhanced/established Result 2019: Given the training and support provided by the MA Technical Advisors, the following 3 processes have been enhanced: 1) process to facilitate handling of UNMAS Iraq and wider mine action matters within the JCMC and GOI departments that are in direct contact with clearance activities; 2) process to enhance JCMC's ability to have a comprehensive approach towards mine action and mine action entities in Iraq, to help manage the safe return of IDPs; 3) process to enhance monitoring and analysis of existing mine action capacities, to help manage clearance activities and guide them to the most affected and in-need areas.

title.narrative: Output 2: Risk education/awareness is delivered to populations at risk

description.narrative: Output indicators: 1. # of beneficiaries, where possible disaggregated by sex and age 2. # of at-risk workers provided with risk education/awareness or safety training (humanitarian personnel, cash-for-work workers, others as applicable)

title.narrative: Output 2: Risk education/awareness is delivered to populations at risk

description.narrative: Output indicators: 1. # of beneficiaries, where possible disaggregated by sex and age 2. # of at-risk workers provided with risk education/awareness or safety training (humanitarian personnel, cash-for-work workers, others as applicable)

comment.narrative: The number of returning IDPs continued to increase in 2018 from approximately 3,220,000 people on 1 January to 4,113,000 people on 31 October, while approximately 1,860,000 people remain displaced (according to the IOM Displacement Tracking Matrix).

title.narrative: Output 3: Mine action capacity of Government entities and authorities is enhanced

description.narrative: Output indicators: 1. # of trainings provided to mine action authorities 2. # of mine action coordination meetings facilitated 3. # of relevant MoI personnel trained 4. # of individuals (gender disaggregated) from relevant government entities who receive training / attend workshops

title.narrative: Output 3: Mine action capacity of Government entities and authorities is enhanced

description.narrative: Output indicators: 1. # of trainings provided to mine action authorities 2. # of mine action coordination meetings facilitated 3. # of relevant MoI personnel trained 4. # of individuals (gender disaggregated) from relevant government entities who receive training / attend workshops
